comments.commentBody: Ouch, that is quite ironic, hypocritical and such a cliche, but I can see the reasons behind it, more like their fears. But overall, don't you think they are getting into more clash with Iran rather then getting the relations from tensions at least to neutral? I mean, unless they want to get in a war in the future.

Response to Alysheba's reply:

Clearly you don't understand logical thinking, Alysheba:

1. You start with your conclusion.

2. You determine what assumptions are necessary to support your conclusion.

3. You figure out how to present those assumptions as if they were all self-evident points that merely need to be listed before you leap to your conclusion.

4. You put pen to paper, laying out a string of "self-evident" assumptions in a sentence or two at most, and then hammer away for sentence after sentence after paragraph at the conclusion to which you are inexorably led by those assumptions.

I hope this helps.

The school called MMT taught Krugman why US is not Greece. Until summer 2011 he didn't know.

http://krugman.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/01/02/mistakes-and-how-to-deal-wit...

btw, MMT predicted the 2008 crisis (unlike Krugman) and the Euro debacle (unlike Krugman) - already in ... 1997!

PK is great though that he constantly learns and modifies his position, unlike the neoclassicals or "monetarists".
So well said!
thank you martin for setting the correct context for this debate.

Thank you, Mr. Stein.

When I was a child of an economically disadvantaged refugee, I had all the system supports to make it in this country: social security following my father's death when I was 8 to subsidize my mother's meager income, good public schools K-12, superb public libraries, pre CA Prop 13 free access to museums and cultural events, and a government scholarship to graduate school in socially desired profession. My mother also had access to excellent insurance in her job as a school aide to physically disabled children, something missing and stressing millions of parents & families.college loans that could be payed off in the economy I inherited when I graduated, heavily subsidized transit systems so I could afford to go,

I also graduated with the sure knowledge that I would find a job and be likely financially better off than my widowed mother. For the last 30 years, all these benefits have been chipped away. How cleverly the 1% utilizes people like Brooks to disguise this fact. My capable son, with a college education, has only been able to find a half-time job.

I would gladly pay more taxes so teen mothers, displaced and unemployed workers and immigrants could take advantage of college/technical educations, have childcare, etc because every capable person lost in this economy and culture eventually affects us all.

If Occupy Wall Street is such hokum, then why is income inequality most likely to be THE campaign issue of 2012, which until their movement started no one, was talking about..

The fact is that the GOP doesn't care about Maddie or anyone like her. Their vision of society, their opiate, is a nihilistic Ann Rand like economic law of the jungle, and if Maddie is having a hard time, in Herman Cain's world :"blame yourself" The GOP world is about survival of the fittest unregulated primitive laissez faire capitalism where the strong devour the weak..

You astoundingly fail to link the relationship between corporate loopholes, cutting taxes on the 1%, and unnecessary subsidies all extract wealth out of the economy and deprive the government of revenue it needs to invest in job creation infrastructure, education, and other social needs.

Yes," insecure men do stupid and self destructive things," like attacking the wrong country, cutting taxes on the rich in times of war, starting two wars without funding, creating a Medicare Part D program without funding, selling people mortgages they could never afford to pay because of hidden interest increases leading to a foreclosure crises, packaging these unleveraged bad loans and selling them to investors and then betting on their failure causing a banking crises that almost caused our economy to collapse, continuing to proselytize
trickle down economics and the myth of corporate job creators both of which have been disproved.

I'm trying to take solace in the fact that a young team with a rookie coach is given credit for almost- but not quite- beating a veteran team from you Noo Yawkers.
Congrats! You earned it.
But we'll be back.
We're really irritated now and if we can vacuum up a couple of wide receivers this off-season.........

I commented earlier with an example of Welsh for "Good Luck!" but it seems the gatekeeper didn't like it because my comment was deleted. In any case, it was a good example of a word using "w" as a vowel. Too bad you can't see it.
I notice there is, for me, some delay after I post, even if I do an immediate refresh. It was not there, you wrote, and now it is: an obvious case of vowel movement

JollyG, your comment was there earlier today, along w/ some other Welsh-oriented comments.

Now gooo-o-o-one....
"Sometimes Y and W." When do we get 7 theme entries that bat for the entire vowel cycle?
No REPENTing, John...we'd be lost without you. but we could do without DUH.
I can't do another recommend because it will actually take it away, but  this is a really delightful expression of appreciation for a nice puzzle.

Deb, Cannot believe you have watched all the Show of Shows in poor cinema. I watched most (if not all) in real time. Imogene was a delight and Sid was so slap-stick. Carl Reiner was the real genius.

This is why I loved this puzzle:

I look like Tweedledee.
I played with die cast toys, but soldiers, not cars.
I am John Doe.
I drool all the time.
As a lawyer I favor due process, even if it's not timely.
I have no Tie Dyed Shirts, but I have Tommy Bahama shirts.
And, finally, I am always repenting for what I say here....
I believe this is a reference to the 2006 film about the origins of the CIA, "The Good Shepherd," which was directed by Robert De Niro and starred Matt Damon.

V-AIR(Y)COOL!

I was down to MEETJOHNDOE before I realized what was going on....at which point the forehead-slap Doh! And then to find the niggling little gotcha @ 50D...very cute, very SAXy

am wondering, however, about the CIA being the Good Shepherd org'n...not exactly an oxymoron, but...????
And I just said a tearful goodbye to my 1974 Opel.

Warrin' Howie, my old!

It wasn't till early last year that I finally divorced Little Blue, my '88 Acura Integra. which didn't even qualify for Cash for Clunkers, since it still got 24 mpg. Only someone who's cajoled a beloved old car toward 200k could fully appreciate 'knock on hood' ....loved it!!

Your ? about Lawrence: no, not L of Arabia. There was a post on either Sat or Sun from (standalone) Lawrence from Durham, NC. i recall the comment being about magma being so-called while underground, but lava after eruption. I remember because I agreed w/ him
i WOULD AGREE (OOPS CAPS) with you on AIR COOLED, but the answer was AIR COOL, and it made no sense to me as an active verb.

C'mon Deb and Richard, AIR COOLED is merely waving a hand fan in front of your face while you sit there for an endless hour in the First Baptist Church in Paducah, Kentucky with no air conditioning in July listening to why you should REPENT for your sins.
Lots of words share the MAN root, Howie - manipulate, manual, manufacture, etc.  French, main.  Spanish/Italian, mano.  Portuguese, mao.  Latin, manus.

There was a movie, 'The Good Shepherd' with Matt Damon as the protagonist.  It was well-done, but understated, and I believe was meant to delineate the manner in which a job such as his eventually cut him off from any significant relationship (or full humanity.)  So I got that one.
It's handbook in Spanish.

14A The CIA call themselves "The Good Shepherd Org....you got to be kidding me...The CYO would be the more proper answer!
"Gray's Elegy in a Country Churchyard" is the quintessential poem of it's kind!
I guess MANO @29D is where we get Manual from?
IMHO, 14A has ELMOS driven me over THEEDGE!

WHH

It was a riot. I thought someone would certainly end up in traction.

My favourite clip, however, is the 'Big Business' lunch...amazing what they do with the sandwiches there

Deb, You rascal, you.  That Show of Shows was a parody of Ralph Edwards' (emcee for the radio show “Truth or Consequences”) "This Is Your Life."  When viewing it today, it reminds me of SNL parodies of other shows.  It really is funny, slapstick and all....

really? did you research all 1.4 billions of them? what about Tim Mcveigh, a christian, who slaughtered innocents including women and children, or the by Norwegian self-described christian crusader, driven by his xenophobia to massacre in cold blood dozens of his own countrymen, or the zealous violent Christian anti-abortionists who kill doctors and bomb clinics, or the christian Nazis who exterminated jews, or the crusaders who in the middle-ages slaughtered in the name of Jesus tens of thousands of Muslim and Jews, or imperial colonialism practiced by Christian Europeans to pillage and occupy Arab & muslim lands in the 20th century? shouldn't we by your own logic then condemn Christianity and label Christians as terrorists?

I knew when I saw Indy after Casino16 that it was only a matter of time before the New England bashing reared its head.  So sad that what was once a fun rivalry has dissipated with such alarming alacrity.  And now the Patriots have an opportunity to play in the Super Bowl in Indiana.  I can only imagine the angst in Indianapolis.

Sure, 5:30am - I'll have a go.

Now that I'm here I can't resist mentioning that Yakima is a fine wine producing area. I have a couple of bottles from Snoqualamie in my cellar right now. When I left California 34 years ago Paducci in northern California was the furthest north in the U. S.

I hope you keep the comments coming, Mac

Elaine grew up farming in the Yakima valley (Wapato and Toppenish) and we've returned to the scene of the crime many times.  A winery tour today is like what touring Napa was forty years ago, before it became a Disneyland annex.  The Yakima valley is also a lot more spread out.  From Zillah through Prosser (where Snoqualmie is) to Benton City covers a lot of ground.  But it's very beautiful country with the hop fields of Moxee and the apple orchards everywhere vying with the vines.

Mac K
glad you ran
out of lurk

Enjoyed this puzzle but at 12:27 it seemed a bit easier than many Tuesday puzzles. Perhaps because I'm old and the dated clues were right up my alley. Been lurking here and finally decided to post. I enjoy the commentary as much as the puzzles. Thanks tor the entertainment.

Thank You very much NYT Editor. Why do you think NO ONE and I mean NO ONE is talking about it? In my mind he's the most important player that's gonna be on (or off) the field Feb 5th.

NYT editor: Well, the game is two weeks away, so even if he is hurt there is time to heal. And remember: Gronkowski came back into the game against the Ravens, so it's not like the leg is broken in a couple places. In either case, you can probably bet he would only miss the Super Bowl if they had to take his foot off.

Ah the typical attack on CAIR by an pro-Israel sypamathizer is not surprising now is it?

Tell me what does an "undicted co-conspirator" mean anyway? Does it prove CAIR's guilt? Its innocence? Or the very fact, the Bush administration chose to make a political statement by brushing all 300 Muslim organizations with that label, akin to the political marginalization it gave when boycotting the NAACP.

Also please tell us if CAIR is the arm of MB or al-Qaeda why does it fully function in broad daylight without FBI, one of the most thorough investigative agencies, not finding anything illegal about it? Guess they are part of the plot by the Brotherhood and takeover of the US aswell?
@Free Thinker: Sir, do you work for the NYPD?

Nassir you're being disingenuous. Unidicted co-conspirator means they were connected with the case. CAIR officials have busted for terrorism related activities, including fronting for Hamas. For example Mousa Marzook is a fugitive from US Justice, convicted of abetting and aiding terrorists or Randall Royer also busted..So your claim that there has been nothing illegal about it, is nonsense. So yes not, only pro-Israel sympathizers should be concerned about CAIR's activities, but so should any American concerned about National Security.

To compare CAIR with the NAACP is insulting.

What is more of a "puzzle" is the fact that you somehow manage to mention an Israeli group which opposes withdrawing from the West Bank (not really relevant to this story) while completely ignoring the fact that the Council on American Islamic Relations (CAIR) was an unindicted co-conspirator in a Federal terrorism investigation. Considering the fact that the New York CAIR president is quoted in this article, that might be important information - along with the fact that CAIR is the US branch of the Muslim Brotherhood, a very peaceful organization which has given the world Hamas, Al Qaeda and many others that I'm sure the NYPD shouldn't be worried about.
horrific. When will the investigation of this renegade police force begin?

That's absurd. Most Muslims living in the U.S. are peace loving people who came here to escape the intolerance of their homeland. I have personally worked with Muslims and all the people who I worked with were sweet and loving people who I would trust with my grandchildren.

That's not to say that there aren't any Muslims in the U.S. who hate this country and wish us harm, but there are Christians and Jews here who also hate this country or at the very least, hate the ideal of what it represents. There are a lot of Timothy McVeigh's out there.

At a company I recently worked at for five years, Muslims, Hindus, Christians, Jews and maybe a Buddhist or two (as well as some Atheists) all worked together. It's not that everyone loved each other, but if they didn't, it had NOTHING to do with their religion. That's the America that I love. Not the paranoid America that thinks every Muslim is a terrorist. We were wrong when we ostracized the Japanese during WWII and we're wrong now.

Having said that, we still have to defend ourselves against terrorists. But raising paranoid fantasies about terrorists taking over our government is ridiculous. It reminds me of that TV movie from decades ago which I think was called Amerika in which we lose a war to Russia. The purpose of that show was to make us paranoid about the Soviets and hate them. All we've done now is changed the team that we've decided we're supposed to hate.

the country has been gripped by xenophobia! if this is what is being shown to police officers of New York, the most liberal of all cities in this country, wonder what's being shown to the rest of the police forces?  It's no longer the land of the free...its the land of the persecuted.
Ray Kelly should resign!

That is absurd and factually incorrect. Look it up - most terror attacks on Americans abroad  and in America are perpetrated by  Islamic terrorists. Fortunately most attempts in this country have not succeeded.

It's pretty obvious that a 9-11 reactionary anti-Muslim inquisition has been in progress since the Bush-Cheney era. Most terrorist attacks in this country are committed by Christians, such as Timothy McVeigh and the anti-abortionists, but there is never any intention of organizing an anti-Christian reaction.
NU, please do believe me that not ALL Americans hate Muslims.  I am very sorry that so many of us have filled the media with hate these days and wish you only peace to you and your family.

Naj,
It is wrong for state sanction propaganda to be used against any minority esp. with their own tax-dollars be they in Musilm or non-Muslim country.

This outrage in America is not preconditioned how various sects in the world are treating each other.

This is America, and such blatant propaganda against any minoirty shouldn't be happening in our nation, period.

Are you equally as "saddened" and "concerned" by the endless Sunni vs. Shia massacres? Female genital mutilations and subservience? Hate speech and jihad against the west preached by imams? Medieval rule of law by the Taliban?

Don't get angry at the messenger.

Truly saddens me as a Muslim and concerns me for the future of my children. Most people believe these days that they have evolved to a higher social consciousness yet, it is my belief that the human instincts that led to holocaust and in more recent times the ethnic cleansing in Bosnia or the mass killings in Rwanda are not far from the surface of our modern day sophistication. What's more shocking is that these inflammatory demagoguery is funded by pro-Israel groups who are of the Jewish faith, honestly I ask, How can you be so irresponsible with your millions and your conscience? How can you look at yourself when that day might come when the fruits of the seeds you sow come in the form of a major atrocity against innocent humans who are happen to be Muslims. I for one am only left with a heavy heart to see what this country is coming to, and I dread what the future holds for myself and my coreligionists.

"Go read Thomas Friedman's columns in this very newspaper!

Why on earth would I subject myself to something like that?

r - because if you read Thos Friedman, you might learn something. Ordinary Person is right - the Protocols of the Elders of Zion, for instance,  is widely distributed and believed in the Islamic Middle East. The existence of one kind of racist bigotry does not justify another. Two wrongs don't make a right, didn't your mother ever tell you?

So any discussion of terrorism is demonizing Muslims? Film(S)?, I only noticed one in the article. Adleson supported one Clarion project before this one and no connection was made to the film in question.
You are not much of a scholar.

So a hard-core supporter of the Israel lobby is behind propaganda films demonizing Muslims?

Shocking, isn't it?

Every Muslim nation is an Aprtheid. An Apartheid against Jews, An Apartheid against Xtians,. An Apartheid against women, and an Apartheid against gays. To pretend this has nothing to do with Islam is simply blind political correctness. No, not every Muslim is a terrorist, And Muslims have probably been victimized more by Islamic terror than anyone else. And while every Muslim is not a terrorist (who ever something that stupid in the first place) most terror attacks world wide are by Muslims. Thats a fact. Deal with it. And the reason is Islam. Xtianity went through several refformations to the point where civil law could be divorced from religious law. This is not yet the case with contemporary Islam.

You can bury your head in the sand if you want. But that doesn't make inconveinient truths go away.
